question: [File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Overall design] [Round transitions] When moving transactions to new rounds during discarding, can tracker state become inconsistent if mark_txn_ordered is called with old round_id values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Overall design] [Last round partitioning] If partition_last_round is false and transactions are merged, can tracker state become inconsistent with the actual execution plan? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Overall design] [Tracker proliferation] Can an attacker create unlimited unique storage locations to force creation of unlimited trackers, exhausting validator memory? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Overall design] [BTreeSet growth] For long-lived storage locations, can pending/finalized sets grow unboundedly over many blocks, eventually exhausting memory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Overall design] [Range query cost] Can an attacker craft shard boundaries that force expensive O(n) range queries for every transaction, causing quadratic complexity? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Overall design] [Lock duration] Can an attacker craft transactions that hold tracker locks for extended periods, blocking other transactions and causing liveness issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Overall design] [Type confusion] PrePartitionedTxnIdx and OriginalTxnIdx are both usize - can mixing them up in tracker operations cause incorrect conflict tracking? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Overall design] [ShardId validation] There's no validation that shard_id in mark_txn_ordered is < num_executor_shards - can out-of-bounds shard IDs corrupt the partition matrix? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Overall design] [RoundId validation] Can negative or extremely large round_id values in mark_txn_ordered cause integer overflow in ShardedTxnIndexV2 comparisons? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Overall design] [StorageLocation validation] Is there validation that storage_location is valid and not crafted to cause issues in equality comparisons or serialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Test function] [Wrapped range testing] The test only covers simple wrapped range cases - can complex multi-shard wraparound scenarios expose bugs not caught by tests? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Test function] [Concurrent testing] The test is single-threaded - can race conditions only manifest under concurrent access that tests don't cover? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Test function] [Negative testing] Tests don't cover error cases like calling mark_txn_ordered without prior add_candidate - are these scenarios properly handled? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Struct field: finalized] [Ordering assumptions] Does code assume finalized BTreeSet maintains insertion order or natural ordering, and can this be violated? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Struct field: finalized_writes] [Subset relationship] Should finalized_writes always be a subset of finalized? Can bugs cause finalized_writes to contain entries not in finalized? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Struct field: finalized] [Range query correctness] When querying finalized with ShardedTxnIndexV2 ranges in PartitionState methods, can the ordering break if round_id or shard_id wrap around? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Struct field: finalized_writes] [Last writer detection] In PartitionState::last_writer, range queries over finalized_writes assume proper ordering - can this be violated? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Overall design] [Transaction reordering attack] Can a malicious validator manipulate tracker state to reorder transactions within a shard, enabling front-running or MEV extraction? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Overall design] [Selective censorship] Can a validator controlling the anchor shard for a hot storage location selectively censor transactions to that location by manipulating the tracker? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Overall design] [Dependency injection] Can an attacker inject fake finalized transactions into finalized_writes to create false dependencies and block legitimate transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Overall design] [Shard imbalance] Can manipulating anchor_shard_id assignments cause severe shard imbalance where one shard gets all transactions, negating parallelism benefits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Overall design] [Consensus disagreement] If validators disagree on tracker state due to non-determinism, can this cause consensus to fail or validators to produce different state roots? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Function: has_write_in_range()] [Full range wraparound] If a range spans all possible txn_id values (wrapped from 0 back to 0), does the logic correctly detect all writes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Function: has_write_in_range()] [Adjacent shards] When checking conflicts between adjacent shards where end_txn_id = start_txn_id + 1, can boundary transactions be incorrectly included/excluded? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/conflicting_txn_tracker.rs] [Function: has_write_in_range()] [Reverse range] What happens if start_txn_id and end_txn_id are swapped by accident - does this cause false positives/negatives? (Medium)
